description.p: Now, allow me to remind you why you so fear the dark.

Dark and full of terros, it is not hard to understand why many evil gods hold the night as their domain. For them, the light is the home of weakness, to be snuffed out at every turn. Clerics to these deities spread fear of the night by embodying the most terrifying of nocturnal predators. Channeling the power of their gods, they can control the darkness, strike without warning, and, for those truly devoted, infiltrate the dreams of the unaware. For them, there is no greater success than when brazen adventurers travel into the dark, only to be swallowed by it whole, never to be seen again. Deities of this domain include Shar, Tharizdun, Takhisis, and Lolth.
You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Night Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with hand crossbows and short swords. You also gain proficiency in the Stealth skill if you donâ€™t already have it.
At 1st level, your adoption of the dark has honed your sight. You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from your race, its range increases by 30 feet.

sheet.description: You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If your race grants you darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain the senses of the deadliest predators of the dark.

As an action, you invoke your holy symbol and gain the ability of echolocation, granting you blindsight out to a range of 60 feet. This effect lasts for one minute, and while active you can perceive your surroundings without relying on sight. This effect will not function while you are subject to the deafened condition.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you become adept at laying ambushes and acting at night. While in dim light or darkness, you can use a bonus action to take the Disengage or Hide action.

sheet.description: You can use a bonus action to take the Disengage or Hide action.

description.p: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with the deadly venom of creatures of the night. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cuase the attack to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns, when you hit with a weapon attack, you can choose to add an extra 1d8 poision damage.
Once on each of your turns, when you hit with a weapon attack, you can choose to add an extra 2d8 poision damage.

description.p: When you reach 17th level, you manifest several traits of the deadliest night hunters. Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You also gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
Further, you now have advantage on any Dexterity (Stealth) check that you make whil in dim light or darkness.
